socratic_questions:
1. Can you explain what the exponent represents in the expression $10^{0.5}$? 
2. How can we simplify the expression $(10^{0.5})(10^{0.3})(10^{0.2})(10^{0.1})(10^{0.9})$ using the rule for multiplying powers with the same base? 
3. What do you get when you add the exponents of the powers of 10?
4. Can you simplify the expression further using the rule for adding exponents?
5. What is the value of $10^{0.5}$?
6. What is the value of $10^{0.3}$?
7. What is the value of $10^{0.2}$?
8. What is the value of $10^{0.1}$?
9. What is the value of $10^{0.9}$?
10. Finally, what is the simplified value of $(10^{0.5})(10^{0.3})(10^{0.2})(10^{0.1})(10^{0.9})$?
